title: Luxembourg
excerpt: A small wealthy country in Western Europe
text: Luxembourg is a small wealthy country in Western Europe, located between Belgium, France, and Germany. Luxembourg City, the capital, is known for its fortifications and location on the Alzette River. Luxembourg has a population of about 660,000 and is one of the world's wealthiest countries by GDP per capita. The country is known for its banking industry and financial services. Luxembourg joined the European Union in 1957 (as the European Economic Community) and adopted the Euro in 1999. The country is officially bilingual with Luxembourgish and French as main languages. Luxembourg is home to many European institutions including the Court of Justice of the European Union.
